head.title: One Year. Fresh Arrivals. New York.

hedline.hl1: One Year. Fresh Arrivals. New York.

abstract.p: Robert Spero letter on September 17 special issue notes that, after 30 years in suburbs, he and his wive have returned to New York City (S)

block.p: Thirty years after we left New York for the suburbs, my wife and I have escaped back to Manhattan -- to an apartment a few blocks from where I lived when I first came to the city, in 1956. Of course, many things have changed. What hasn't is how I feel at 67: I'm a kid again, drinking in the city as if it were the first time. I have rediscovered Central Park, and it has never looked so beautiful.
